name: 3-cyclohexyl-3,4-dihydro-1H-isochromen-1-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2603
Reason: The compound '3-cyclohexyl-3,4-dihydro-1H-isochromen-1-one' is composed of several functional groups that impact its melting point. The base structure we'll consider is benzene, which typically melts at 5.5 degrees Celsius. Next, we add the effects of the functional groups: - The cyclohexyl group adds steric bulk and has a tendency to slightly increase the melting point: +20 degrees due to increased molecular size and hydrophobic interactions. - The dihydroisochromen group introduces a degree of rigidity to the molecule with the partially saturated ring system and the lactone structure; such systems often significantly increase the melting point due to additional van der Waals forces and possible hydrogen bonding: +50 degrees. - The ketone (carbonyl) group can participate in dipole-dipole interactions which may further increase the melting point, although less so than large substituents or rigid ring systems: +10 degrees. Combining these, the predicted melting point elevation due to these functional groups would be approximately 80 degrees higher than the base benzene structure.
